channel.title: [Tut]-vb8-Login boxes
channel.description:
For this you need visual basic 2008 (vb8).
Visual basic 2008 ( vb8 ) download link: www.microsoft.com/express/download You need the express edition.
1 ) Start vb8 and choose the option 'new project' (click on 'create project' and then on 'ok')
2) Add a textbox and a button.
3 ) Click 1 time on the button, go to properties, scroll down to 'text', and change it to "Login!"
4 ) Now dubbleclick the button, normal there stands:
[code]Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
End Sub[/code]
5 ) Between that, type: [code]If TextBox1.Text = ("PASS") Then MsgBox("Je hebt het juiste wachtwoord ingevoerd.") Else MsgBox("Je hebt het foute wachtwoord ingevoerd.") End If[/code]
6 ) Now it will look like this:
[code]Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click If TextBox1.Text = ("PASS") Then MsgBox("You entered the good pass..") Else MsgBox("You entered the wrong pass..") End If End Sub[/code]
7 ) The pass is now "PASS", you can change it by replacing "PASS" by another word.
8 ) If you entered the good password, there will pop-up a messagebox that says: "You entered the good pass.", if you entered a wrong password, it will say: "You entered the wrong pass." (you can edit this text to!)
9 ) If you enter the pass in the textbox, you will see the letters that you are typing, if you want a password char click 1 time on the textbox, go to properties again, and search for passwordchar, enter there somthing. exaple: *
//All credits to me =P

item.title: [Tut]-vb8-Login boxes

This is like stuff you see in the first challenges of them hacking tutorial sites, lol

item.title: [Tut]-vb8-Login boxes
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:17, topic:292261”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=386133.msg2937602#msg2937602 date=1251652965]
true

you simply remove the comparison and jump instructions
[/quote]
This is VB8, which gets compiled to CIL, which is as easily decompiled as Java Bytecode…You will won’t even have to mess with CIL, much less asm.[/quote]

Fuck that, CIL editting = pwn.

In this you’d probably just replace a brtrue.s or brfalse.s with a pop br.s or pop depending on which it is (the instruction before would be call on String::op_Equality)

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut]-vb8-Login boxes
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Invoke:

This is actually very useful if someone wanted to password protect their executable file.

You can disassemble/decompile it you know, hardcoding passwords is never the way to go.

catthoor:
You mix Dutch with English sentences at step 5 and 6 lol.
Also you should rename your button/textbox to a more describing name (bu_Login and tb_Password for example)

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut]-vb8-Login boxes
item.dc:creator: @catthoor catthoor
item.description:
@catthoor wrote:

For this you need visual basic 2008 (vb8).

Visual basic 2008 ( vb8 ) download link: www.microsoft.com/express/download
You need the express edition.

1 ) Start vb8 and choose the option ‘new project’ (click on ‘create project’ and then on ‘ok’)

  1. Add a textbox and a button.

3 ) Click 1 time on the button, go to properties, scroll down to ‘text’, and change it to “Login!”

4 ) Now dubbleclick the button, normal there stands:

[code]Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click

End Sub[/code]

5 ) Between that, type:

If TextBox1.Text = ("PASS") Then MsgBox("Je hebt het juiste wachtwoord ingevoerd.") Else MsgBox("Je hebt het foute wachtwoord ingevoerd.") End If

6 ) Now it will look like this:

Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click If TextBox1.Text = ("PASS") Then MsgBox("You entered the good pass..") Else MsgBox("You entered the wrong pass..") End If End Sub

7 ) The pass is now “PASS”, you can change it by replacing “PASS” by another word.

8 ) If you entered the good password, there will pop-up a messagebox that says: “You entered the good pass.”, if you entered a wrong password, it will say: “You entered the wrong pass.” (you can edit this text to!)

9 ) If you enter the pass in the textbox, you will see the letters that you are typing, if you want a password char click 1 time on the textbox, go to properties again, and search for passwordchar, enter there somthing. exaple: *

//All credits to me =P

Read full topic
